Package space.sunqian.fs.eventbus

Interface SimpleEventBus

public interface SimpleEventBus
This interface is a simplified event bus interface. It provides simple methods to register and unregister event subscribers with the specified event type, and post methods to post events with the specified event type.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static enum 
    SimpleEventBus.DispatchMode
    The dispatch mode for posting events.

  • Method Details

    • newEventBus

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull SimpleEventBus newEventBus()
      Creates a new event bus, all event consuming will be executed in the post thread. It is same as newEventBus(Executor) with the executor: Runnable::run.
      Returns:
      a new event bus

    • newEventBus

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull SimpleEventBus newEventBus(@Nonnull @Nonnull Executor executor)
      Creates a new event bus with the specified executor.
      Parameters:
      executor - the executor to execute event subscribers
      Returns:
      a new event bus

    • register

      <T> void register(@Nonnull @Nonnull Type type, @Nonnull @Nonnull Consumer<@Nonnull T> subscriber)
      Registers an event subscriber for the specified event type.

      The default implementations use copy-on-write to add subscribers, so it is recommended to use register(Map) for registering multiple event subscribers at once.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the event type
      Parameters:
      type - the event type
      subscriber - the event subscriber

    • register

      void register(@Nonnull @Nonnull Map<@Nonnull Type,@Nonnull List<@Nonnull Consumer<@Nonnull ?>>> subscribers)
      Registers event subscribers with the specified event types, the keys of the map are the event types, and the values are the event subscribers.
      Parameters:
      subscribers - the event subscribers

    • unregister

      void unregister(@Nonnull @Nonnull Object subscriber)
      Unregisters an event subscriber which is registered via register methods. The subscriber object is the same object that is passed to register methods.

      The default implementations use copy-on-write to remove subscribers, so it is recommended to use unregister(Iterable) for unregistering multiple event subscribers at once.

      Parameters:
      subscriber - the event subscriber, which is the same object that is passed to register methods

    • unregister

      void unregister(@Nonnull @Nonnull Iterable<?> subscribers)
      Unregisters event subscribers which are registered via register methods. The subscriber objects are the same objects that are passed to register methods.
      Parameters:
      subscribers - the event subscribers, which are the same objects that are passed to register methods

    • post

      default void post(@Nonnull @Nonnull Object event)
      Posts an event. This method will call post(Object, Type) with event and event.getClass().
      Parameters:
      event - the event to post

    • post

      default void post(@Nonnull @Nonnull Object event, @Nonnull @Nonnull Type eventType)
      Posts an event with the specified type. This method will call post(Object, Type, DispatchMode) with event, eventType, and SimpleEventBus.DispatchMode.BROADCAST.
      Parameters:
      event - the event to post
      eventType - the event type

    • post

      default void post(@Nonnull @Nonnull Object event, @Nonnull @Nonnull SimpleEventBus.DispatchMode dispatchMode)
      Posts an event with the specified dispatch mode. This method will call post(Object, Type, DispatchMode) with event, event.getClass(), and dispatchMode.
      Parameters:
      event - the event to post
      dispatchMode - the dispatch mode

    • post

      void post(@Nonnull @Nonnull Object event, @Nonnull @Nonnull Type eventType, @Nonnull @Nonnull SimpleEventBus.DispatchMode dispatchMode)
      Posts an event with the specified type and dispatch mode.
      Parameters:
      event - the event to post
      eventType - the event type
      dispatchMode - the dispatch mode
